properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 9:55AM CST until February 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Lakeshore flooding is likely. Strong north to north-
northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph will
build waves to 8 to 11 feet with occasional waves up to 14
feet.

* WHERE...Shoreline areas of Cook County Illinois.

* WHEN...Thursday morning through Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...The winds and large waves combined with record high
lake levels could exacerbate already significant beach and
shoreline erosion sustained in the past several months. In
addition, low lying and flood prone areas including portions
of the Chicago bike path may be impacted. Large waves may
sweep onlookers into the lake.
properties.instruction:
A Lakeshore Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds will
generate flooding of low areas along the lakeshore.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY
